events.originalText: Gas explosions in Kaohsiung, Taiwan, killed 32 people and injured 321 others.
events.subtitle: 2014 Kaohsiung gas explosions
events.headline: Gas explosions in Kaohsiung, Taiwan, killed 32 people and injured 321 others

events.originalText: The largest power outage in history occurred across 22 Indian states, affecting more than 620 million people, or about 9 percent of the world's population.
events.subtitle: 2012 India blackouts
events.headline: Largest power outage in history affects over 620 million people in 22 Indian states

events.originalText: The Troubles: Operation Banner, the British Armed Forces' operation in Northern Ireland, ended after 38 years with a military stalemate and ceasefire.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: Operation Banner in Northern Ireland ends after 38 years with military stalemate

events.originalText: Following intestinal surgery, Fidel Castro provisionally transferred the duties of the Cuban presidency to his brother Raúl.
events.subtitle: Fidel Castro
events.headline: Fidel Castro transfers Cuban presidency duties to brother Raúl after surgery

events.originalText: Hamas detonated a bomb at the Mount Scopus campus of the Hebrew University of Jerusalem, killing nine students and injuring about 100 more.
events.subtitle: Hamas
events.headline: Hamas bomb at Hebrew University of Jerusalem kills nine students

events.originalText: Three years after being hit by a mudslide, the Ten Thousand Buddhas Monastery in Hong Kong fully reopened.
events.subtitle: Mudflow
events.headline: Ten Thousand Buddhas Monastery in Hong Kong fully reopens after mudslide

events.originalText: Soviet Special Purpose Police Unit troops killed seven Lithuanian customs officials in Medininkai in the most serious attack of their campaign against Lithuanian border posts.
events.subtitle: OMON
events.headline: Soviet troops kill seven Lithuanian customs officials in Medininkai

events.originalText: The Troubles: In a botched paramilitary attack, three members of the popular Miami Showband and two Ulster Volunteer Force gunmen were killed in County Down, Northern Ireland.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: Miami Showband members and gunmen killed in botched paramilitary attack in Northern Ireland

events.originalText: The Troubles: Hours after the British Army's Operation Motorman brought an end to the self-declared autonomous area of Free Derry (Free Derry Corner pictured) in Northern Ireland, three car bombs exploded in the village of Claudy.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: Car bombs explode in Claudy hours after Operation Motorman in Free Derry

events.originalText: Apollo program: The first Lunar Roving Vehicle was used during the Apollo 15 mission to the Moon.
events.subtitle: Apollo program
events.headline: First Lunar Roving Vehicle used during Apollo 15 mission to the Moon

events.originalText: The pleasure cruiser MV Darlwyne disappeared off the coast of Cornwall with the loss of all 31 people aboard.
events.subtitle: Loss of MV Darlwyne
events.headline: MV Darlwyne disappears off Cornwall coast with 31 people aboard

events.originalText: A team of Italian climbers became the first to reach the summit of K2 (pictured), the world's second-highest mountain.
events.subtitle: 1954 Italian expedition to K2
events.headline: Italian climbers first to reach summit of K2, world's second-highest mountain

events.originalText: The Holocaust: Under instructions from Adolf Hitler, Hermann Göring authorised SS General Reinhard Heydrich to handle preparations for "the Final Solution of the Jewish question".
events.subtitle: The Holocaust
events.headline: Hermann Göring authorizes preparations for 'Final Solution of the Jewish question'

events.originalText: Herbert Payne's bill introducing compulsory voting in Australia was passed into law.
events.subtitle: Herbert Payne
events.headline: Compulsory voting introduced in Australia with Herbert Payne's bill

events.originalText: First World War: The Battle of Passchendaele began near Ypres, Belgium, with the Allies aiming to force German troops to withdraw from the Channel Ports.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Battle of Passchendaele begins near Ypres, Belgium in First World War

events.originalText: The Second Continental Congress passed a resolution commissioning the Marquis de Lafayette (pictured) as a major general in the American revolutionary forces.
events.subtitle: Second Continental Congress
events.headline: Marquis de Lafayette commissioned as major general in American revolutionary forces

events.originalText: The Second Anglo-Dutch War ended with the signing of the Treaty of Breda.
events.subtitle: Second Anglo-Dutch War
events.headline: Second Anglo-Dutch War ends with signing of Treaty of Breda

events.originalText: Sergius IV became the 142nd pope, succeeding John XVIII.
events.subtitle: Pope Sergius IV
events.headline: Sergius IV becomes 142nd pope, succeeding John XVIII
